review: I have satellite television on two of the TVs in my house but wanted something for the TV in the rec room, which only has an outdoor antenna connected. The only Internet TV service that I have at this time is Amazon Prime, but so far that has proven to be more than adequate. It takes a bit of maneuvering and navigating through various menus to find the programs that you want to watch but once you have found them they pop up on the top "recently watched" line which makes it easier to allow you to continue watching programs in the same TV series. I was wondering how easy it would be to search for specific titles given the limited number of buttons on the remote control. But it has really turned out to not be that difficult since the fire stick pops up a list of possible titles as you navigate through the on-screen keyboard with the up/down, side-to-side arrows and usually you don't have to type more than 3 or 4 letters until the program you are looking for comes up on the list. The fire stick combined with Amazon Prime has turned out to be a good investment. Everything I have managed to find to watch is included with Amazon Prime so I have not had to pay additional fees for other services or pay per view. By adding Hulu, Sling or other streaming services you could greatly expand your choices even further.
